name: Blockstorm
description: Blockstorm is a FPS game set in a world made of destructible blocks. All maps and characters included in the game are made with the same tools that are available to the public. You can build everything in Blockstorm, and you can destroy it.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP with SP2 or later Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 8600M GT DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 200 MB available space Additional Notes: With the minimum configuration, disable dynamic shadows and effects
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i3 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTX 550 ti DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 512 MB available space

reviews.review_text: It's a really good game. Here's a list of pros and cons: [EDIT: I decided to edit a few points in my review, based on the comments of it. I also decided to put a few additional points based in my experience so far. ]   Pros: - Smooth Gameplay - Easy Controls - It's a balanced game - Map Editor - Character Editor - Equipment Editor - Just enough gamemodes - Friendly Community ( Well, most of it ) - The Devs hear what the people has to say, and make updates based on it - Has cards - Up to this day that my review was made ( 05/22/15 ), i wasn't able to find any single cheater in the game  Neutral: - Features a destroyable environment  Cons: - As it features an destroyable environment, in most of the rooms you play, you'll certainly find 2 or more griefers, which will definitely screw up the whole match. - Your Equipment Editor is limited to only a few blocks more to add. (Example: you can't turn an AK-47 into a Bullpup weapon) - Short maps don't take long to turn into a No Man's Land. - As far as I played, I couldn't find a single game that my ping wasn't under 400. ( Not that my game turns into a complete laggy mess, but sometimes it troubles me )  Blockstorm has the features that I thought I would find in Ace of Spades ( The new one, not the classic ), and definitely something that Blockade 3D will NEVER have. Do not consider this game a Minecraft clone. Believe me, the only thing similar to Minecraft is just the digging and the placing blocks feature. As I saw on their website, it will have some really cool updates coming ( including drivable vehicles )  For giving me a really entertaining experience so far, 9/10. Really recommend buying it.

When I played the demo version of this game, I wasn't really impressed. About four months later, I dared to buy this game and was totally surprised how much fun I had first time playing the full game. I became addicted to Blockstorm and got along quite well, although I have a lack of experience in pc-gaming. However, I've also learned to use the editor and created some nice maps, but I envy the people, who have the talent to create characters for the game because it's so hard... :P  Sincerely, TheLastOfTheSkyPirates / SkyPirate

This game is a pixel based shooter, but is different in a ton of ways.  Pros: -Great Workshop Support -Great Optimization (Was able to run at 30+ fps with vanilla Intel HD Graphics) -Great Weapon Balancing -Easy Server Hosting (with hamachi) -Good amount of game modes.  Cons: -Snipers are very slow -Small amount of official servers and they can get really full fast.  Overall I give it an 8/10, it's a very good game but it has it's few bad points but overall it's very good, I would reccomend getting the 4 pack and playing it with some freinds because that's the best way to!

Game: Blockstorm Price: 7.99(I got it for 1.39) Genre: Building, FPS  Blockstorm is an fps and a building game. It has several game modes such as TDM, DM, CTF, and more! It has weapons that range from shotgun to smg. The game allows you to customize maps, your character, and weapon skins! You can also build in the middle of a match. Building can be the most helpful in CTF.   Gameplay: 8/10 Music/Sound: 7.5/10 Replayability: 9/10 Customization: 9.5/10 Building: 8/10 Worth it? Yes! The game is worth the money. I simply enjoy the game.  Overall rating: 8.4/10
